meanings.definition: An extensive plain, especially one without trees.
meanings.sent1: The vast steppes stretched out endlessly before us.
meanings.sent2: The nomads roamed freely across the steppes.
meanings.sent3: The cows seemed to enjoy grazing on the steppes, with no trees to block their view.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like the steppes, wide and open, with no obstacles in sight.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the steppes under the clear blue sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A large area of flat unforested grassland in southeastern Europe or Siberia.
meanings.sent1: The steppes of Siberia are known for their harsh winters.
meanings.sent2: Many unique species of animals thrive in the vast steppes of southeastern Europe.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game of tag on the steppes, their laughter echoing across the open grassland.
meanings.sent4: His ambition soared like the eagle over the steppes, aiming for new heights.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered secrets as it swept across the steppes, carrying tales of ancient times.
